Friday, June 12, 2020

Dear Pottsgrove Community and Families:

As we close the out the 2019-20 school year, I am left with an overwhelming debt of gratitude to all of you. Without question, this has been the most challenging year in education in our lifetimes.

I want to thank each and every one of you for your patience, grace, and positivity through this unprecedented time.

We will continue to provide updates and remain transparent as we begin planning for the 2020-21 academic year.

However, today is for us to simply say THANK YOU!

Enjoy your summer, stay safe, and healthy.

Respectfully,

Bill Shirk

Superintendent of Schools

Wednesday, April 15, 2020

Re: Change to the district calendar

Dear Pottsgrove Community:

Last evening the Pottsgrove Board of School Directors approved a change to the 2019-2020 school calendar. The Board unanimously agreed to move the final professional development day of this academic year from Tuesday, April 28th to Friday, May 1st.

This revised schedule will ensure that all students will receive four continuous days of instruction under our Continuity of Education plan.

To re-iterate, May 1st is a teacher in-service day and there will be no educational obligation for students.

Sincerely,

William R. Shirk, Jr., Ed. D.
Superintendent of Schools

Thursday, April 9, 2020

Re: School Closure

Dear Pottsgrove Families,

As many of you already know, Governor Wolf has ordered all K-12 schools and programs, public and private, to be closed through the end of the 2019-20 academic year. Pennsylvania Pre-K Counts, Head Start Supplemental Assistance Programs and Preschool Early Intervention programs will also remain closed, and institutions of higher education are prohibited from offering in-person instruction.

While this may not be the news we were hoping for, it will allow teachers and administrators to move forward with our Continuity of Education program that has already begun.

While there are many unanswered questions from this announcement, I can assure you that we will continue our due diligence as we navigate through these uncharted waters.

In the meantime, enjoy the arrival of spring, the warmer temperatures, and the simple joys that they bring.

Sincerely,

William R. Shirk, Jr., Ed. D.
Superintendent of Schools

Saturday, March 28, 2020

Re: Breakfast/Lunch Program

Dear Pottsgrove Families,

After providing over 10,000 meals to Pottsgrove families last week, we are preparing for our breakfast and lunch distribution for the Week of March 30th.

The pick-up sites will remain the same at both West Pottsgrove and Lower Pottsgrove Elementary Schools.

Pick-up at Lower Pottsgrove Elementary School will take place along the lower Portico off of Buchert Road.

And at West Pottsgrove Elementary School, distribution will take place along the driveway near the main office of the school.

HIGHLIGHTS OF OUR DISTRIBUTION PROGRAM:
• Breakfast/Lunch packages will include (5) days of food.
• Monday, March 30th will be the ONLY pick-up day for the week.
• Times for distribution will now be 10:00 am to 12:00 pm.

We appreciate all the feedback and we will continue to work together to strengthen our community through this important quality of life program for our families.

Sincerely,

William R. Shirk, Jr., Ed. D.
Superintendent of Schools

Tuesday, March 17, 2020

Re: Breakfast/Lunch Program

Dear Pottsgrove Families,

After providing more than 670 meals to Pottsgrove families this morning, we wanted to update you on some changes to help alleviate some of the concerns we experienced today.

Beginning tomorrow, Wednesday, March 17th, we will provide a combined breakfast and lunch package for the next three days (Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday) at both West Pottsgrove and Lower Pottsgrove Elementary Schools from 9:00 am to 12:00 noon. This will alleviate parents having to make daily trips. The hours for Wednesday, the 17th will remain the same at both locations.

As we move forward, we will communicate any changes beginning next Monday, March 23rd as we move forward. Please be assured, we will make sure this service continues for our families throughout the entire school closure.

We appreciate all the feedback today and we will continue to work together to strengthen our community.

Sincerely,

William F. Shirk, Jr., Ed. D.
Superintendent of Schools

Dear Parents and Community Members:

On Thursday, March 12, 2020 the Pottsgrove School District was notified by Governor Tom Wolf, that all schools in Montgomery County will close for a minimum of two weeks and one day.

As of this message, all Pottsgrove Schools will be closed starting tomorrow, Friday, March 13th and returning on Monday, March 30, 2020.

This closure will affect all district schools, including ALL before-and after-school activities.

We will continue to update you through our usual communication platforms as information is shared to us the Governors office.
I encourage you to check our website at www.pgsd.org for periodic updates.

***The middle school musical performance of Frozen, Jr. will be held this evening, Thursday, March 12 at 7:00 pm in the ms auditorium.

Respectfully,

Dr. William R. Shirk, Jr.
Superintendent of Schools
